metadata.titleEn: Mineral whole rock geochemical and isotopic data set of basic rocks in ophiolites of the Tibetan Plateau (middle part of Bangong Nujiang suture zone )
metadata.description: The data set includes the whole rock major and trace elements, Sr Nd isotopes, zircon U-Pb ages and trace elements, single mineral electron microprobe and plagioclase ar ages of the basic rocks in the ophiolite of the middle part of the Bangonghu Nujiang suture zone, Qinghai Tibet Plateau. The sampling time was 2014-2016, and the locations were the South Bank of ponco and the West Bank of Namco. The rock samples include 7 high magnesian andesites, 3 vitrinite dikes, 4 gabbros and 14 basalts on the South Bank of pengcuo. The data provide support for the study of the material composition, chronology and geochemistry of the central Tibet ocean floor plateau and the Cenozoic oceanic inner arc fragments, and are of great significance for understanding the formation and evolution of the Bangong central Tethys ocean floor plateau and the Cenozoic oceanic inner arc. The main and trace elements of the whole rock were measured by XRF and ICP-MS, respectively. The zircon U-Pb dating and trace elements were measured by la-icp-ms. the main elements of single mineral were analyzed by EPMA. The whole rock SR Nd isotope was measured by ion exchange resin separation and ICP-MS, The AR ar age of plagioclase is obtained by laser heating and isotopic analysis after the sample is irradiated by nuclear reactor, and the data are true and reliable. The testing units include State Key Laboratory of metallogenic mechanism of endogenetic metallic deposits in Nanjing University, modern analysis and testing center of Nanjing University, State Key Laboratory of continental dynamics in Northwest University, AR, u-th-he geochronology Laboratory of Institute of Geology and Geophysics, Chinese Academy of Sciences, and EPMA Laboratory of School of resources and environmental engineering, Hefei University of technology. The article of the data set has been published in the well-known journal "Gondwana research". According to Google academic statistics, it has been cited 18 times.
metadata.instructions:
1. File name:
(1) The whole rock geochemical major and trace data are stored in Excel format, and the file name is "MajorTraceElement2014001.xlsx", in which MajorTraceElement represents content, 2014 represents year, and 001 represents serial number.
(2) The whole rock geochemical SR Nd isotope data is stored in Excel format, and the file name is "Sr-NdIsotope2014001.xlsx", in which Sr-NdIsotope represents the content, 2014 represents the year, and 001 represents the serial number.
(3) Zircon U-Pb age data are stored in Excel format, and the file name is "U-PbDating2014001.xlsx", in which U-PbDating represents the content, 2014 represents the year, and 001 represents the serial number.
(4) Zircon trace element data is stored in Excel format, and the file name is "ZirconTraceElement2014001.xlsx", in which ZirconTraceElement represents content, 2014 represents year and 001 represents serial number.
(5) The single mineral EPMA data is stored in Excel format, and the file name is "ElectronMicroprobe2014001.xlsx", in which ElectronMicroprobe represents content, 2014 represents year and 001 represents serial number.
(6) The AR ar age data of plagioclase is stored in Excel format, and the file name is "Ar-ArDating2014001.xlsx", in which Ar-ArDating represents the content, 2014 represents the year, and 001 represents the serial number.
2.Data reading mode:
The data can be directly opened in Excel workbooks.

Example.Question: Can you provide an example of how data collection methods are utilized to determine the geochemical composition of ophiolite sequences in the Tibetan Plateau?
Example.Answer: Data collection methods for determining the geochemical composition of ophiolite sequences in the Tibetan Plateau involve using X-ray fluorescence (XRF) for major elements, inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry (ICP-MS) for trace elements, and laser ablation inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry (LA-ICP-MS) for zircon U-Pb dating and trace element analysis. Additionally, single mineral major elements are analyzed using electron probe microanalysis (EPMA), and whole rock Sr-Nd isotopes are tested through ion exchange resin separation and ICP-MS testing. Ar-Ar dating of plagioclase is conducted by irradiating samples in a nuclear reactor, followed by laser heating and isotopic analysis.

Feature Specification.Question: What are the specific characteristics of the geochemical and isotopic data collected from mafic rocks in ophiolites within the Bangong-Nujiang suture zone?
Feature Specification.Answer: whole-rock major and trace elements, Sr-Nd isotopes, zircon U-Pb ages and trace elements, single mineral electron probe analysis, plagioclase Ar-Ar ages

Quantification.Question: How many rock samples were collected from both locations for the geochemical and isotopic analysis?

Definition.Question: What is meant by '全岩主微量元素测试' in the context of geochemical data collection in ophiolite studies?
Definition.Answer: '全岩主微量元素测试' refers to the analysis of major and trace elements within whole rock samples, typically conducted using techniques like X-ray fluorescence (XRF) for major elements and inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry (ICP-MS) for trace elements. This type of testing is crucial for understanding the geochemical composition and history of ophiolitic rocks in studies.

Instrumental/Procedural.Question: What procedures are implemented to gather and analyze geochemical and isotopic data from ophiolites in the context of understanding the formation and evolution of oceanic plateaus and intra-oceanic arcs?
Instrumental/Procedural.Answer: Geochemical and isotopic data collection from ophiolites involves sampling rock specimens from relevant geological locations, such as the southern shore of Pengcuo and the western shore of Namco. The procedures include using X-ray fluorescence spectrometry (XRF) and inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry (ICP-MS) to test whole-rock major and trace elements. Zircon U-Pb dating and trace element testing are conducted using laser ablation ICP-MS (LA-ICP-MS). Single mineral major element analysis is performed with electron probe microanalysis (EPMA), while whole-rock Sr-Nd isotope testing employs ion exchange resin separation and ICP-MS. Ar-Ar dating of plagioclase is achieved by irradiating samples in a nuclear reactor followed by laser heating and isotopic analysis. These methods are carried out by research labs such as Nanjing University, Northwest University, the Chinese Academy of Sciences, and Hefei University of Technology, ensuring the data's reliability for understanding the geological processes within the region.

Enablement.Question: What technological and methodological advancements enable the accurate collection and analysis of mineral and whole-rock geochemical and isotopic data in ophiolites from regions like the Tibetan Plateau?
Enablement.Answer: The collection and analysis of mineral and whole-rock geochemical and isotopic data in ophiolites from regions like the Tibetan Plateau are enabled by several technological and methodological advancements. These include the use of X-ray fluorescence (XRF) for major element analysis, inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry (ICP-MS) for trace element and Sr-Nd isotopic analysis, and laser ablation ICP-MS (LA-ICP-MS) for zircon U-Pb dating and trace element analysis. Additionally, electron probe microanalysis (EPMA) is used for analyzing major elements in single minerals, and the Ar-Ar dating technique, involving neutron irradiation and laser heating, is employed for determining plagioclase ages. These techniques, supported by facilities such as the Nanjing University and other key laboratories, ensure reliable and precise data collection.
